incidents.name: Small Number of Voice Calls Are Failing Stir/Shaken Attestation

incident_updates.body: The issue that caused a small number of Voice calls to fail Stir/Shaken Attestation has been resolved and is operating normally at this time.

We continue observing recovery in issue that is causing a small number of Voice calls to fail Stir/Shaken Attestation. Due to this issue, these voice calls are getting signed as Attestation C. incidents.name: Users Unable to Login to Flex via SSO

incident_updates.body: Flex was degraded between 10:06 AM and 1:40 PM Pacific Time on 07/22/2025. During this time, some customers may have experienced problems logging in via SSO. The issue has now been resolved.

Our engineers are currently investigating the customer impact of a retroactive issue with users being unable to login to Flex via SSO. We will follow up and provide customer impact details within 30 minutes.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with users being unable to login to Flex via SSO. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Newly Signed up Customers Requesting a Managed Certificate for Link Shortening in Messaging, Will Stay in Pending Status With “Your Certificate Is Being Processed.”

incident_updates.body: We have fully investigated the newly signed up customers requesting a managed certificate for link shortening in messaging, will stay in pending status with “Your Certificate Is Being Processed.” All current customers using the messaging API will not be impacted on their operations, and it was determined that the impact was limited to a small set of customers, who have been contacted individually to address any concerns. All systems are operational.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Newly signed up customers requesting a certification for link shortening for Messaging, will stay in pending status with "your certificate is being processed". Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Failed Message Status Callbacks

incident_updates.body: Twilio Messaging was degraded for 3 minutes between 03:41 and 03:44 Pacific Time on 07/16/2025. During this period of time customers using AWS SNS may have experienced failed messaging callbacks. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: Predictive Operators Failing to Execute

incident_updates.body: The issue causing a delay in completion of transcriptions and operator results with a subset of customers with predictive operators enabled is now resolved and Conversation Intelligence is now operating normally.

The issue causing a delay in completion of transcriptions and operator results with a subset of customers with predictive operators enabled is now resolved and Conversation Intelligence is now operating normally. We will continue to monitor for system stability. We'll provide another update in 30 minutes or as soon as more information becomes available.

Upon further investigation, we have confirmed that Conversational Intelligence is the product affected by the ongoing incident. We are actively investigating the issue with a subset of customers with predictive operators enabled that may see a delay in completion of transcriptions and operator results. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Upon further investigation, we have confirmed that Conversational Intelligence is the product affected by the ongoing incident. We are actively investigating the issue with a subset of customers with predictive operators enabled that may see a delay in completion of transcriptions and operator results. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

A subset of customers with predictive operators enabled may see a delay in completion of transcriptions and operator results. We will provide another update in 1 hour or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: SMS Delivery Failure to United Kingdom via Subset of Pre-Registered Sender ID

incident_updates.body: We are no longer experiencing SMS delivery failures when sending messages to the United Kingdom via Pre-Registered Sender IDs. This incident has been resolved.
